text: Icy Blu (born Laurel Yurchick, June 1, 1974) is an American recording artist who had a brief pop career in the early 1990s. ==Career== In 1991, Icy Blu released a self-titled album containing the singles "Pump It (Nice an' Hard)" and "I Wanna Be Your Girl". Both singles entered the Billboard Hot 100 chart. "Pump It (Nice an' Hard)", which samples Salt-N-Pepa's "Push It", reached the top 10 in AustraliaAustralian (ARIA) peaks: *Top 50 peaks: *Top 100 peaks: and New Zealand, and was the fortieth highest-selling single of 1991 in Australia. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Album ! rowspan="1"| Peak chart positions |- ! width="35"| AUS |- | scope="row"|1991 | scope="row"|Icy Blu | 100 |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Single ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="35"| US ! width="35"| AUS ! width="35"| NZ |- | rowspan="2"| 1991 | align="left"|"Pump It (Nice an' Hard)" | 78 | 8 | 4 | align="left" rowspan="2"| Icy Blu |- | align="left"|"I Wanna Be Your Girl" | 46 | 88 | 15 |} ==References== Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:American female pop singers Category:American pop singers Category:American female rappers Category:20th-century American singers Category:Musicians from Texas Category:Musicians from Austin, Texas Category:20th-century American women singers Category:21st-century American singers Category:21st-century American women singers
title: Icy Blu
